answers.answer: There are many things this could be, or it could be nothing at all. (I assume the room isn't too warm). If it concerns you, see your doctor. It can't hurt to be tested for diabetes if you have other symptoms as well. You might be experiencing low blood sugar during the night. Try a snack before bed.

question: I sweat a lot when I sleep. I don't feel like I've rested if I don't sweat. Its only on my neck & chest that I sweat. not my face or extremities. I've done this since I was a teen (41 now) but have never been diagnosed with diabetes. Occasionally my sweat smells sweet, but not with any consistency. I have not noticed my urine smelling sweet. What else might it be?
title: I'm so sweet
